required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Breastfeeding Promotion RCT and Child Metabolic Syndrome

collaborator.agency: Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD)

brief_summary.textblock: The overall goal of the PROBIT study is to investigate the influence of a randomized breastfeeding promotion intervention designed to increase the duration and exclusivity of breastfeeding ("the breastfeeding promotion intervention") on the development of maternal and child health outcomes. The hypothesis is that randomization to the intervention will be associated with lower child adiposity, lower risk of asthma and atopy, improved lung function, and improved cognitive outcomes.

primary_outcome.description: Occurrence of 1 or more episodes of gastrointestinal tract infection

secondary_outcome.description: insulin measured on dried blood spots
Apo B measured in dried blood spots
Research measures of blood pressure at ages 6.5, 11.5 and 16 years
Research measure of maternal blood pressure
Growth in weight, length, weight for length, BMI, and other measures

secondary_outcome.time_frame: to age 12 months and throughout childhood
secondary_outcome.description: Number of respiratory infections, from review of medical record
Eczema from review of medical record, parent report,and direct examination

clinical_study.condition: Effect of Breastfeeding on Maternal and Child Health Outcomes

arm_group.description: Breastfeeding promotion according to World Health Organization's Baby Friendly Hospital Initiative

intervention.description: Breastfeeding promotion and support according to the World Health Organization's Baby Friendly Hospital Initiative

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Birth at one of 34 Maternity Hospitals in Republic of Belarus
- Breastfeeding initiated at birth, with no contraindications to breastfeeding
- Apgar score >=5 at 5 minutes
- Full term gestation
- Birth weight > 2500g
